attributes.action: All NHS, Police, Fire service and Armed forces personnel to receive 20% pay rise
attributes.additional_details: Public sector workers have had no choice during the Covid-19 outbreak but to continue working. A 20% pay increase would bring Public Sector workers back in line with inflation after years of austerity, pensionable wages that were lost during the 10 year pay freeze. This increase MUST not affect subsequent wage growth for a minimum of 10 years. All subsequent annual pay rises must maintain the status quo of inflation.
attributes.background: A 20% pensionable pay increase should be given as recognition for services during Covid-19 outbreak.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Immediate 25% pay rise to all healthcare professionals,fire fighters and police: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310216

Increase NHS Police Fire & Ambulance Staff personal allowance to £35k for 12mths: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313322

Link pay rises for the emergency services + public sector to same % as MPs: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310753

Fund an above inflation, respectful pay rise to all public sector workers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315198
